snippet: A program aimed at teaching children to appreciate books gives them a chance to make paint with insects and work with 22-carat gold.
abstract: Morgan Library and Museum, in collaboration with the New York City Department of Education, introduces the Morgan Book Project, a free program for public schools that aims to instill in children an appreciation for books by providing authentic materials to write, illustrate and construct their own medieval and Renaissance-inspired illuminated manuscripts.
lead_paragraph: A program aimed at teaching children to appreciate books gives them a chance to make paint with insects and work with 22-carat gold.

headline.seo: For Children, Lessons in Medieval Manuscript Illumination
headline.main: Teaching Children the Value of Pre-Web Pages
headline.print_headline: Teaching Children The Value of Pre-Web Pages
